title: Wait so what's going on? In the US, the supreme court can override state laws?
body:
I live in Canada, so this is about as much as I know about "state laws" -> marijuana is illegal in the entire USA. State laws can override this and make it legal in their state.

Does this mean the "supreme court" could "declare marijuana illegal in all 50 states" and every state that has declared it legal would have to stop selling it? How is this different from it already being illegal in the entire USA, but overruled by individual state laws?

Someone pls explain.
